entry.title: Webinar | Nov 18 | Databricks Batch and Streaming
entry.summary: November 18, 2pm ET hosted by Wintellect Databricks is a leading big data processing service available on Azure. One of…
entry.content:
November 18, 2pm ET hosted by Wintellect

Databricks is a leading big data processing service available on Azure. One of the nicest features in Databricks is the ability to develop workloads that run in batch or streaming modes.

In this webinar, Wintellect will review the basics of a notebook running in batch mode. In this example, we’ll be focusing on Delta Tables for our sinks. You will learn the differences between batch and streaming and just how easy it is to convert a notebook to streaming mode. We’ll also review streaming limitations within Databricks. Finally, we will walk you through an example of how to develop a job that can be parameterized to run a notebook in both modes.

entry.title: New Service | Azure Container Apps
entry.summary: Microsoft Azure now has a new method for deploying containerized applications that require orchestration without the steep learning curve of…
entry.content:
Microsoft Azure now has a new method for deploying containerized applications that require orchestration without the steep learning curve of Kubernetes. Azure Container Apps allows you to write code using your preferred programming language or framework and build microservices with full DAPR (Distributed Application Runtime) support.  Easily configure dynamic scaling of containers based on HTTP traffic or other events.

This service is built on top of Kubernetes but provides a simple, serverless experience that can enable dev and ops teams to quickly.

With the scale to zero option, you can configure the service so you are only paying for when your app is active in response to events and/or requests.  This is a very low cost way to quickly jump into the world of containers!

Learn more here

entry.title: Webinar | Nov 16 | The Power of GitOps for Deploying Frequently
entry.summary: Learn more and register here!
entry.content:
Nov 16, 2021 | 2:00 pm - 3:30 pm Eastern Time
 
Teams across organizations keep learning about "Kubernetes" and deciding to try it for greenfield/brownfield projects, especially with microservices-style architectures. Commonly, many of these teams continue to use basic push-based CI/CD practices that they would generally use on other platforms. However, Kubernetes has a massive advantage over other platforms, and that's GitOps.
 
Learn about the power of GitOps for Kubernetes-based workload so that you can understand how application teams can be more efficient and deliver more value to the business.
 
We'll cover:
  • The typical CI/CD pipeline
  • The problems, especially with microservices
  • What is GitOps?
  • Understanding its power
  • When it's not a great fit
  • Choosing a solution, quick comparison
    • ArgoCD
    • Azure Arc (Flux)
    • Tekton

Learn more and register here!
